title: Warwick needs a hotfix
body:
Take a balanced champion that sits at 50% win rate (old warwick) and then

- Buff his dueling potential
- Buff his chasing
- Increase his healing
- Give him global presence
- Reduce his mana costs
- Let him trigger his blood scent at MAX with a press of a button
- Give him another form of CC
- Give him a dash
- Give him an escape
- Make his Q follow dashes
- Give him damage reduction

Surprise, surprise !!! Turns out Warwick is broken now. Who would've guessed when the only compensation he received for all these massive buffs was "wellp, his ulti is now a skillshot"

And then you will have people on these boards and Reddit swearing how Warwick and Sion are balanced & fair champions.

Nerf his damage reduction early game, I understand why he needs it late game but early game it's just an overkill, nerf his fear duration during the early game, and nerf the range on his global scent in the early game, so that he can't move up and down the map with a perma ghost. 

inb4 "It's the keystone!" , "Its his mains playing him!", etc etc

That has every relevance. You had a combination of poor decision making on his part coupled with just about every cooldown you could have on your end while he did not have those. If he had his ult like you, it's a different scenario.

In the end, your personal anecdote doesn't outweigh the general performance and dominance of the champion. When you give WW a heavy crutch like he had in your video, then sure, it's possible to, just barely, kite him. But most times, people don't have the luxury of having all their defensive cooldowns up while also having the help of a blast cone while having tower shots and a laner to come flank. Of course Warwick can be killed, and you've shown just that. But to use this video as "evidence" that Warwick can simply be kited is ignorant. If you came back with a montage of you kiting WW over and over consistently, then sure, but a single, stars-align scenario? It holds no merit. 

Cloud drake, by the way, only works out of combat. So it helped him get to you, sure, although with diminished effect since movement speed has a soft cap. So once he got that first hit on you, that entire dragon is worthless. Also, if you look, most of the chase he did not have it. He had it for the briefest of a second after he landed on the other side of the bush from the blast cone. It's indicated by the misty white effect. So to imply that you somehow out kited this speed demon of a champion with his double cloud drake and passive is fairly misleading. The cloud drake was just about irrelevant. What was relevant is that you're citing that this champion can be kited under the scenario that you have all your cooldowns up and he does not. If you were to recreate this scenario under equal terms, being all cooldowns up, or at least equal cool downs, the Warwick would most likely tear you apart. 

That's the realistic scenario most champions deal with. It's why Warwick is climbing in ban rate. I'm not saying you did a bad job in that clip, there's a reason you clipped it. I'd honestly wager most people without a firm grasp on Lux would have died there, so good on you. But don't try and use that clip to suggest that Warwick is easily kiteable. That's laughable at best. I'm sure there's clips out there of squishies kiting Akali or Zed's one shotting Ornns. Can it happen? Yes. Is it probable or even likely? No.

Actually, that's wrong. Win rate is not meaningless on its own. There are other factors, but if something its 56% win rate, there's no excuse. The whole, "winrate doesn't mean everything" is the argument used to not buff champs at 47-49% because playrate drives win rate down, so it could lead to an overbuff since the idea is that players new to a champion should be doing poorly while experienced players should be doing well. 47-49 is just under 50 so that means the vast majority that are novices aren't dragging the win rate down as much as they should since the mains are doing very well, hence the true power of a champion.

But 56%? On a high play rate champion? That means not only are mains doing well, novices are as well. The champion is a problem. There's no excuse for a 6% variance except in the rarest cases being a champion has such an abyssal play rate yet his mains are finding great success, so you cannot nerf that which isn't played. Think Karthus. Warwick though? High play rate, high win rate. Even without the play rate, unless he was pre rework yorick/galio/urgot level, that's an unacceptable number.
